Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a light-brown pottery vessel, interior slightly grooved and exterior slightly ribbed, with faint traces of two lines of black-painted hieratic text on the exterior identifying contents as wine and mentioning head vintner Pahu.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393158) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393158)
